oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 f
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 f. Newspaper clipping: 'Citizenship Class Work Complimented.' (Possibly March 1921?).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: CITIZENSHIP CLASS WORK COMPLIMENTED Mrs. L. C. French, in her official capacity as chairman of the good citizenship class which is conducted every Thursday afternon at 3 o'clock at the Lawson McGhee li- brary has just received a letter from the head, of the Welfare de partment of one of the large coal companies commenting upon te work of the class. The letter is as follows: "I notice from the papers that you are still conducting the classes in Good Citizenship, and I wanted to write and tell you how very important I think this is. Recent events have shown this. The election of superintendent of city schools for example. I do not believe you could make a better contribution to the times, or serve in a better way that to help develop the naturally public spirited side of women. My experience of five years as social service worker has shown me this In fact it seems to me the men need some such help as much as we do I hope much from the advent of women into public affairs, and your classes will, I feel sure further this (rest is missing)
